sentences.en: A case of measles kept him in bed.
Adults are often immune to German measles.
sentences.cn: 成人往往对风疹有免疫力。

sentences.en: An unmodified attack of measles usually confers lifelong immunity.
sentences.cn: 自然经过的麻疹,一般产生终身免疫.

sentences.en: Imagine if we have an outbreak of measles and the information is relayed to us three months after the outbreak.
sentences.cn: 想像一下如果我们已经爆发了麻疹，而消息是在爆发后的三个月后才传到我们这里。
麻疹折磨着这个小女孩.
麻疹是一种传染性疾病.

sentences.en: Measles, mumps and whooping cough are spreading again because children are not being vaccinated.
sentences.cn: 因为孩子们没接种疫苗，麻疹、腮腺炎和百日咳又蔓延开来。

sentences.en: The doctor is quite definite about Tom having measles.
sentences.cn: 医生十分肯定汤姆得了麻疹.

sentences.en: The doctor told her to watch out for symptoms of measles.
sentences.cn: 医生叫她注意麻疹出现的症状.

sentences.en: These antibodies work against the measles virus.
sentences.cn: 这些抗体有对抗麻疹病毒作用。

sentences.en: This is why many viruses, such as measles, make us ill only once.
sentences.cn: 这就是为什么许多病毒，如麻疹，只会使我们生病一次。

sentences.en: When I was five I got measles.
When you have the measles, you break out in spots.
sentences.cn: 当你得麻疹时会出疹子.

words.tran_cn: 患麻疹的；极少的；低贱的

trans.tran_cn: <医>麻疹，[兽]（牛，猪的）囊虫病，[摄]斑点，<美俚>梅毒，麻疹的红斑点
trans.tran_en: an infectious illness in which you have a fever and small red spots on your face and body. People often have measles when they are children.
